title: Papa John's Pizza
content:
I do not know if ya'all get this pizza in your countries... But, seriously, it is the best pizza ever.

My school serves it on Fridays... yum...

Gimme a can of Pitch-Black Mountain Dew, and a bag of that cheezy mix... And I'm in heaven. I do this often while at Halo parties.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Papa John's Pizza
content:
Whoops... Could a Mod make this a poll?

(Simple yes or no would suffice)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Papa John's Pizza
content:
I've never heard of that brand in my countries.
We get the American style pizzas here, frozen from the supermarket, usually dry and/or bland and/or stuff, and the ones you can order from restaurants, which, depending on the restaurant, can be quite good indeed.
Let's see... Domino's Pizza is one brand... can't think of any other right now.

Edit: We have Pizza Hut here too, I'm pretty sure, and one I can't remember the name of...
I don't normally have pizza delivered myself, or go out to eat franchise pizza.
I have nothing against it though, pizza can be quite good, quite good! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Papa Johns:
content:
A pizza!!! All American... though Italian at the same time.

Papa Johns; We get that at our monthly hot lunch every once in a while. *Checks Calendar* Next Wednesday in fact!!!

I don't really perfer it. I love pizza, but I like others better;

Papa Murphies Take-and Bake Pizza (Best Take and Bake)

Dominoes of Pizza Hut has the best in-store baked pizza ever.

PIZZA!!!

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Papa Johns:
content:
If this were made a poll, what would the question be?

Anyway, I don't think there's any Papa Johns stores anywhere near where I live, but there's been Pizza Hut ever since I can remember and just recently some Dominoes have opened up as well.

Can't really say what place I enjoy pizza from the most, because I usually just buy a few frozen pizzas from the supermarket each week instead of ordering. They obviously don't taste as good, but I'm stingy with money, and they're cheap.--------------

title: Re: Papa Johns:
content:
In our suburb we have Hells Pizza and Pizza Haven, two direct competitors for our stomachs and souls! In the burning, peperroni flavoured fires of fierce culinary battle a new form of pizza was created, the result of a freak stacking of pizza boxes, lots of beer and plain curiosity.

It is the Pizza Haven meat lovers and Hells Pizza everything Pizza placed face to face, together. And the flavour is 1337.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Papa Johns:
content: Here in Australia, we have Pizza Hut, Pizza Haven and Dominoes Pizza.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Papa Johns:
content:
"Here in Australia, we have Pizza Hut, Pizza Haven and Dominoes Pizza."

Don't forget Eagle Boys, they're the only Australian owned pizza franchise in Australia. Well, assuming they're in states other than Queensland... But speaking of Pizza Haven, I haven't seen any of their stores here for ages.

title: Pizza... hmm...
content:
Pinky's Pizza is pretty big in my part of the country. They do some damn classy pizza, though I prefer the smaller restaurant here, Pinoccio's Pizza.

I'm quite dislike cheese nowadays, but at the moment I can manage to ignore it on pizzas as long as it's cooked properly (reddish and crisp) and not oily.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Haven's pizza;
content:
I'm not sure if it's the same, but I had dinner in a Pinoccio's once.
It was part of a franchise, the name was mispelled, and they served other food than just pizza.
I ate there once with a friend of mine (both not pizza).
I think I liked it, but she found the food she chose to be a bit bland.Retodon8
